Javascript is disabled. View full album

Those rocket fuel tanks have low impact tolerance which might make them disintegrate in water. I usually use the oblong airplane fuel tanks since they carry fuel but have a high impact tolerance.

In fact if you want an easy ship keel, you can build the bottom entirely out of airplane fuselage tanks.
I know, that makes sense, but for military purposes, I prefer the keel to be armoured.

That was just shoddy aiming from me, the missiles actually fire very straight.

Also, I'm going to have to quit this battle, my frigates can barely scratch paint.

I know, that makes sense, but for military purposes, I prefer the keel to be armoured.

Mk2 parts have plenty of impact resistance when underwater, and the mk3 keel on my JMSDF Okuma is tough.

The Burke also has a subsurface and laterally stabilized mk2 surface keel.

http://i.imgur.com/Bt38NHZ.jpg

I'm on a new Iphone, so I can't link the ship image outside of my home.

Edited December 28, 2014 by andrew123
How is my boat Andrew? Wha you think? My second try.
Also, I can never get the bridge right. I on my tablet know so I'll have to post pictures tomorrow

...All right, I made a new type of missile:

I tested it against ScriptKitteh's MU SX-3 Ingressor MK2, my Drekevak XXVII, and XIV - much more damage than the old missile. and it's shorter, lighter, better range, and higher TWR, so I can carry 6 on all Heavy Dreks, including this new baby:

Would anyone like to battle me, around Pol? Come on, I'm dying to fight again.
I guess with a high enough tonnage limit, I might be tempted to, after designing heavily armoured and armed destroyers.

I guess with a high enough tonnage limit, I might be tempted to, after designing heavily armoured and armed destroyers.

all right, I was thinking 600 tonnes/4 ships, Pol, no leaving SOI. You want to set up or fire first?

I can't wait to try these babies out.

...All right, I made a new type of missile:

http://i.imgur.com/Njsni5g.png

I tested it against ScriptKitteh's MU SX-3 Ingressor MK2, my Drekevak XXVII, and XIV - much more damage than the old missile. and it's shorter, lighter, better range, and higher TWR, so I can carry 6 on all Heavy Dreks, including this new baby:

http://i.imgur.com/1229aXf.jpg

Would anyone like to battle me, around Pol? Come on, I'm dying to fight again.

OOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOHHHHHHHHHH!!!!! SHINY! do you have one for 0.25? I would like to test it. That missile is very compact looks like its clipped.

OOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOHHHHHHHHHH!!!!! SHINY! do you have one for 0.25? I would like to test it. That missile is very compact looks like its clipped.

It probably works for .25 - I didn't use any Mk3 parts, so it should be fine... compared to my old missile, it's smaller, lighter, more acceleration, better D/V, and I can fit two of them in the space of one old missile- so the Drekevak 30 gets 12 missiles now

However, download is not ready for the public

Would anyone like to battle me, around Pol? Come on, I'm dying to fight again.

I would, but we have a bad history around Pol, and I won't be finished before school.

It probably works for .25 - I didn't use any Mk3 parts, so it should be fine... compared to my old missile, it's smaller, lighter, more acceleration, better D/V, and I can fit two of them in the space of one old missile- so the Drekevak 30 gets 12 missiles now

However, download is not ready for the public

I have a new space missile too.. not a compact as yours, about 1.5x the size. Would you like to test her armament?

You can stuff 12 I can only use 8 on my new ship but they are all purpose missiles one that you can fire at long range. I guess yours is used for direct fire right? or do you have two versions?

Please give it a test, you can download it on my thread, first post. (just click the Kraken )

'evil laugh'

After some experimentation with reinforced tandem warheads, I have officially christened the MBDA Brimstone Mark I. This compact 0.625 m missile takes out space center buildings with extreme accuracy and reliability.

Time to VLS this bad boy. Bye bye artillery cannons.

Yes! I finally got one of my new designs done, and it works as intended.

Meet the almost-ready-for-download MU SX-15!

This ship will feature ion-engine backup propulsion, and also is equipped with up to 4 1.25 meter missiles and 4 i-beam missiles.

(The missile being fired in the pics is an all-new MU next-gen. ASM, designed with guidance systems and a strong armor piercing tip.)

Edited December 29, 2014 by ScriptKitt3h

Yes! I finally got one of my new designs done, and it works as intended.

Meet the almost-ready-for-download MU SX-15!

What's her stats? what about our fight?

http://imgur.com/a/KZFGT

I need to double-check on the stats (I got the pics in a hurry, as I had to make some dinner). Are you referring to the Duna battle? If so, I might be able to. Still need to make sure that my fleet works.

(The SX-11 and 12 models of MU warship are extremely glitchy post-update, but the other work fine.) That's why I'm overhauling my fleet, so that the improvements in hull design from the SX-11 and SX-12 get integrated into functional, non-glitchy, effective .90 warships.

EDIT: I did just double-check, and the SX-15 clocks in at 615 parts (with a full ammo load), and 99.0 tons.

Not bad for a Heavy Frigate. (Then again, I overbuild. )

Edited December 29, 2014 by ScriptKitt3h

I have a new space missile too.. not a compact as yours, about 1.5x the size. Would you like to test her armament?

You can stuff 12 I can only use 8 on my new ship but they are all purpose missiles one that you can fire at long range. I guess yours is used for direct fire right? or do you have two versions?

Im a bit busy updating the fleet to test thing ATM ( some of my ships are aged 6 months XD)

Every missile i make is guided - this one doesn't have advanced SAS so it's more accurate at longer ranges, and has more fuel with less weight.

You choose. I need to develop some heavy warships.....
